headline: Delicious Egg Salad for Sandwiches
description: This egg salad is quick to prep and easy to make with hard-cooked eggs, mayonnaise, mustard, paprika, and green onions. Perfect for sandwiches!

video.description: See how to make a classic egg salad for sandwiches and crackers.
video.name: Delicious Egg Salad for Sandwiches

name: Delicious Egg Salad for Sandwiches

recipeInstructions.text: Place eggs in a saucepan and cover with cold water. Bring water to a boil and immediately remove from heat. Cover and let eggs stand in hot water for 10 to 12 minutes. Remove from hot water, cool, peel, and chop.
Place chopped eggs in a bowl; stir in mayonnaise, green onion, and mustard. Season with paprika, salt, and pepper. Stir and serve on your favorite bread or crackers.

review.reviewBody: Eggcellent! Recipe for hard boiling eggs is spot on. I added salt and vinegar to the water for easier peeling. Used half dijon/half prepared. Next time will only use Dijon. Added some parsley and a pinch of cayenne. Just needs a little crunch.
Very pretty in color. Could use a cruchy element , such as finely chopped celery. I meant to add some fresh, chopped, parsley, but I forgot.
I did add more mustard.
I love egg salad sandwiches, mucho!!
First time making egg salad. This recipe is delicious! I swapped relish for the onion since I don't like onion.

My Grandmother always made this while I growing up and I ate quite a bit of it because I loved it. I grew up with using miracle whip instead of mayonnaise and there was always a bit of Celery for the little extra taste and crunch. So now that I'm a mother of 4 grown children and "13" Grandchildren and at the age of "60" üòä I feel blessed that I can keep this recipe going and that all the children LOVE it. So hats off to you and My Grandmother üòâüíúüíôüíú for this recipe. Keep up the great work posting your recipes. Oh and there was nothing else added to your recipe other than the mayo and Celery and the love I put into it üòÅ‚ù§
Loved it
Very good recipe, with a few additions & substitutions. I substituted dry mustard for traditional mustard, celery for onion, added chopped sweet pickles & a dash of cayenne pepper. Amazing flavor!!
This recipe was so simple and delicious! I used red onions instead of green and smoked paprika but didn't have to make any other changes.

I made this recipe for lunch today and both my husband and I enjoyed it. To the people that are having difficulties getting their eggs hard cooked and shells off perfectly, try an air fryer. I use it to cook my eggs and they are always perfect . I usually use 250 degrees - 6 extra-large eggs- 20 minutes. then a cold water bath for 10 minutes.
Great base to start with. Added celery and 1/4 teaspoon of garlic powder.

I love egg salad sandwiches. I added dill weed in place of the green onion, not too much dill weed. Then after having an egg mayonnaise, what it is called in Ireland, I complimented the egg salad with some slivered beets on top. Delicious!
I added a little relish to the recipe, as well as a dash of cayenne pepper for a little kick. I also added about a 1/2 teaspoon of parsley flakes.
Since egg salad always reminds me of deviled eggs, I've always added a tablespoon (or to taste) of vinegar to my egg salad, just to give it a little 'zing.'
I've made this with both hard boiled eggs and scrambled eggs. Either way, it makes for a good sandwich.

To cook the eggs, I use a different method: First, I bring the water to a boil (with the eggs in it) then simmer for about 20 minutes. You can check when an egg is done by spinning it evenly on the kitchen counter top (away from the edge of course). If it spins freely, it is done. If it just rolls around, it is not. When the eggs are done, I immediately submerse all the eggs completely in cold water. This causes the outer shell to separate from the egg white for easy peeling and allows the hydrogen sulfide gasses to escape, which would otherwise cause a nasty looking green discoloration in the yolk. After the eggs have cooled, I drain the water, peel the eggs, and they are ready to use.
yummy!!! but maybe not mustard

Works well. Tasty. For the eggs, boil water first. 6 mins in boiling water, 6 mins with the heat off, but leave in hot water another 6 mins. No more than that. Next, right into the ice bath for at least 10 mins. Under running water peal.

Im not sure what I did wrong but mine was the consistency of mush. I followed the instructions for boiling eggs but upon peeling I could tell they weren't cooked all the way. I guess I should have used 10 minutes. Also I wished it mentioned something about leaving eggs in ice water for an hour to get them to peel correctly because I basically lost half the egg in that process.
Not bad. Nice and simple. Good even without putting in any celery in it
Great!
I made this for my Boyfriend and his co workers and it was so delicious.

I made this today for my husband and his workers! I can't believe how good it came out. I've always made it plain with mayo and pepper so bland, did not have green onions so I added celery from previous comments and I must say the crunch makes the extra touch! I definitely will be replacing my bland version to this KEEPER!
Loved it.
Perfect egg salad sandwich recipe! I use it every time I have a craving!

Made this with 4 eggs. Celery, green onions, curry powder and paprika, salt and pepper and dill pickle relish. Mayo for base. Little watery, but still delish. Photo is all that is left. Will make again.

Dr. and Dietician told me that I needed more Protein in my diet. I mentioned Egg Salad Sandwich for lunch and they said that would be good. So I find this recipe and I like it. Plan on having this more often for lunch.
a very tasty blend of Ingredients incorporated for very tasty egg ü•ö salad. Just add lettuce and a brioche bun, and serve.
Simple Delicious !!!
I followed the recipe to a T, it was wonderful! The only changes I would make is a bit more mayonnaise (3/4 cup) and a little less mustard to take that super sweet taste out.
Like others, I used this as a base recipe, adding celery and curry. I've bookmarked the recipe--I can never remember how much mayo and mustard to add, and this got those right.

This is my new "go to" egg salad recipe, I never used to add green onions and I love the addition along with a couple TBS minced celery for extra crunch. I also use my Instant Pot for cooking the eggs, set it for eggs (6 minutes) pop them in ice water and the shells slide right off.
no

I was going to make it fancy like some people said, but did not have time and just made the recipe. It was a hit with my Church Homegroup. If I was making for myself, I would put less mayo, but that is my preference.

This was a perfect and easy recipe for egg salad!!! I added chicken and have been pretty hooked on my chicken egg salad sandwiches all week :) Ill be making this egg salad again in the near future Definitely recommend trying
Eggcellent!

We have these influences on vanities of spices in food would upgrade the flavor but the truth is lesser the spices better it tastes while it decrease our unnecessary invitation on stomach or heart disease. Mixture of green onions adds flavor into sandwich. In every situation egg salad sandwiches always win in terms of likable protein.
hubby loved this did add relish per his request. Yummy!!!!!
Used spicy brown mustard and added relish. Delish!
Make with eggs fresh out the coop from today! Very good!
Was delicious!
Yum Yum Yum! I added a little more mayonnaise and some garlic powder and it's delicious üòã
I think this site is good.
It tasted great like other reviewers said. Definitely worth a try!

I agree with another reviewer - the proportions of egg, mayo & mustard in this recipe are perfect. I also agree that it's essentially a blank slate for whatever other goodies you want to include in it. This time, I omitted the onion, added finely chopped celery and fresh dill (because I add on hand). Served in pita pockets. Delicious !
I have been using this recipe for many years. Fast and simple. Sometimes if I have extra peppers from the garden I will add, and sometimes I change up the mustard.
Had no bread so just ate it with a spoon. There is room for improvement, but it's still very good.
My 4 eggs broke apart and didn‚Äôt cook using this method. I let them boil then took off the heat for 12 minutes and MESS! Had to start over with my old recipe.
Excellent
SO GOOD!
I liked it better without the mustard. With the mustard it tastes more like deviled eggs. I also like chopped green olives in it. Don't knock it till you try it.
This is the recipe I always use to make egg salad for my husband and we both love it! So simple and delicious.
Good base. I would add a little curry powder and fresh chopped celery.
I made it the way it was printed and I enjoyed the egg salad....I have also added either white vinegar or Worcestershire sauce instead of mustard. A little different but good!
i did i lil bit to the steps and i like it
Fabulous recipe and so simple!!!

I have always made my own version of egg salad it was ok nothing to brag about. Today I wanted a egg salad sandwich for lunch I figured I would see what different kinds there were. I found this recipe it was very simple and looked good. WOW I was surprised how it all came together and tasted it blew away what I had been making. What is left over I put in the refrigerator and let it chill completely and let all the flavors combine completely. I know it will be so much better!!

Simple & very good. I didn't have green onion so I used red onions instead. Also, I added a pinch of both garlic powder & garlic salt and I added a little Tabasco sauce which added some great flavor. Try the Tabaco sauce on you egg sald sandwich and you'll likely add more to the egg salad bowl. Lastly, I added slices of avocado for some protein & healthy fat.
I'm almost embarrassed to say this is the first time I've made egg salad. Easy & delicious recipe!
Liked it alot only i added a little bit of green sweet relish
Perfect and delicious üòã
Good base recipe. Needs tweaking to your taste.
I added provolone cheese to the recipe to make it perfect besides deleting salt over thin sliced whole grain bread.
Good recipe
Great recipe. Didn't have green onions so used shallots. Came out great! Will make again.
This is delicious! I just put a little more paprika & mustard, but yes, delicious!
I don't like green onion so left it out... EASY and Delicious!!!!
Fantastic! I added green olives with the scallions and what flavor!
Delish! I used dijon and sweet onion. Added a tsp of Garlic Garni (aka crackspice ‚Äîfrom garlicfestival.com). Thank you for a tasty recipe!
Easy and tasty! Made a batch ahead for sandwiches for lunches this week. I did dice up about an 1/8th a cup of dill pickles to put in it too.

I'd give it 5 stars but I didn't have green onion so used dried chopped onion and I love smoked Paprika so used that. Love it! So good and will definitely make again. Thanks for the quick and delicious recipe!
I made it and eating it know pretty good . Too bad my wife dont like onions
Wonderful, I added 1/4 tsp. of sweet relish if you want a sweet/sour taste.
I made this egg salad. I added pickles and it was a great hit.
So delicious!!

Delicious!!! I added a few strips of chopped nitrate-free turkey bacon. My family isn't too crazy about a lot of mayo, so I started with 2 tablespoons my first time, then added a tablespoon at a time until I liked the consistency. Also, for those watching their sodium levels, I didn't add any and it still tasted great. I served this on toasted brioche bread. I've made this recipe twice now, and this time around, I tripled the ingredients of the recipe for those who asked for seconds. Thank you for posting and sharing !
One of the best eggs salad we've had in awhile. we've already made it twice in a week! Thanks for sharing!
The paprika is for a topping not flavor. !5 minutes is better to let the eggs sit. A little sweet relish actually kicks off the salad much better.
Simple recipe! I didn't have spring onions so used lettuce for the crunch!
the boiling time for the eggs is incredibly wrong unless you like all of your egg to come off with the shells

Superb. Since the best place to start improvising is with something that's perfect, I used this as a base recipe, and added my own little touches. I substituted chives for the green onion, simply because I have an abundance of it in my garden, and used curry powder in place of the paprika, because my family prefers it. Served on whole wheat bulkie rolls and a few fresh spinach leaves, this recipe was a hit with the fam!

I will definitely make this again, with a few other improvs, like adding crumbled bacon to the mix, or putting a slice of smoked salmon in the sandwich, then piling the eggy goodness on top.
I followed the recipe without any deviations, and it was really good! No changes are necessary, and so simple with only a few ingredients. I will be making this again
Eggcellent recipe! I added dill as several reviewers had done. I will be making it on a regular basis going forward. Absolutely fabulous salad!
I‚Äôm very young and was in the mood for egg‚Äôs for my breakfast but wanted something new~ and this was definitely it! It‚Äôs delicious I just replaced the green onions with pickle relish
First time I have ever made egg salad. Made according to recipe and it was delicious!
Followed the recipe exactly as is and this was the best egg salad sandwich I ever had. Took a lot longer than expected though, but it was totally worth it.
Delicious! The only change I made was the addition of 1 rib of celery.

So good! I added chopped fresh jalape√±os and topped off with a dash of smoked paprika (in addition to the called for regular paprika) and freshly ground pepper (also in addition to the called for pepper). Delicious!
For my taste i added just a little extra miracle whip.
Good recipe. I added 8 dashes of hot sauce and 2 Tbls pickle relish. Then used my hand mixer to blend it. Made great sandwiches!
I did not add paprika, I added chilli powder instead and it was so good.
This was delicious although I did add 1 1/2 finely chopped celery and 4 tbs. of finely chopped Vidalia onion.
Perfect! Quick and easy, tastes great. We like mustard so I add an extra 1-2 teaspoons depending on the size of the eggs.
I've made this same recipe for Potato Salad and the only addition I made was just to add chopped celery or celery seeds to it. Never thought of using it for a sandwich but a great idea! Thanks!
Classic, easy egg salad recipe. For some extra kick, I added some horseradish. Excellent.

Very good recipe! The type of mustard varies the taste of the egg salad. Yellow, Dijon, coarse ground, all work great. I use a good German mustard. If you can find it, smoked paprika is awesome! Dill weed, dill pickles chopped, or sweet relish are great add ins. They all make great egg salad.
Eggs were runny after 10 minutes of boiling don't use this recipe!
This is great , Just the way my grandmother made it .

Game changer. All these years of making egg salad (just like my mama) and then ran across this recipe. Basically it‚Äôs exactly the same ingredients but the major difference is the technique of mixing the cooked egg yolks with the mayo and mustard for a creamy smooth texture. I‚Äôll never go back to the old way. Learn something new everyday‚Ä¶.very tasty!!
